headline: Mike DeWine and family members are going to the Super Bowl to cheer on Bengals
author: Laura A. Bischoff
sentences:
Parks get temporary names:State parks get Bengals fever and 'Ickey Woods' just wrote itself
The governor is a long time season ticketholder for the Bengals and the Reds and his family owns the Asheville Tourists, a minor league baseball team based in North Carolina.

Laura Bischoff is a reporter for the USA TODAY Network Ohio Bureau, which serves the Columbus Dispatch, Cincinnati Enquirer, Akron Beacon Journal and 18 other affiliated news organizations across Ohio.
Mike DeWine bought tickets to the Super Bowl through the Cincinnati Bengals and will attend the game Sunday in California.
DeWine and his wife Fran and an unspecified number of family members are going, said DeWine spokesman Dan Tierney.
This will be the Bengals' third Super Bowl ever and the first appearance since 1989.
The family will pay its own travel expenses, including the tickets, he said.
The game is Sunday at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California.
Tickets were selling for more than $5,000 a piece.
The Bengals will play the Los Angeles Rams.
